pullRequest.body:
Define incidence algebras

From LeanCamCombi

Co-authored-by: Alex J. Best <alex.j.best@gmail.com>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11783708434/job/32821439917)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11783708434/job/32821439462)
bors d+
bors d+
Let's add these to the bib file in the usual way
Shouldn't this come out of `simps`?
No, because of the difference of implicitness in `ùïú`, but also `ùïú` should probably stay explicit

```suggestion
variable {F ùïú ùïù ùïû Œ± Œ≤ : Type*}
```
I don't think this one is used anywhere
Should work with weaker assumptions? Perhaps similar below
I need `neg_zero`. I don't think I want to be reasoning about `NegZeroClass` in this file
We should add a comment somewhere that `1` refers to the delta function, and mention "delta" by name
This one looks like you can move more bits into the `simp`!
Heartbeats go from 22k to timeout when I do that
There's a bunch of definitions in this file, I'd say a `## Main definitions` would be very valuable
This is an interesting approach! Let's mention it in the implementation notes
This one looks lonely and has no API, I'd say this should wait until a later PR when you have something to do with it!
Yeah, fair
@grunweg, you might want to investigate üòá

Good question! @damiano You are the expert on this part - with the header linter, what's the best way to silence the linter here? One should certainly be able to do (untested)
```
set_option linter.style header false in
set_option linter.style.longLine false in
stuff
To be clear, I would be even happier if https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/8900#discussion_r1806369478 didn't trigger the long line linter at all
This is the line that's too long

```suggestion
/--
The multiplication operation in incidence algebras is defined on an interval by summing over 
all divisions into two subintervals the product of the values of the original pair of functions.
-/
instance instMul : Mul (IncidenceAlgebra ùïú Œ±) where
```
copied from the module doc, feel free to change if you like

```suggestion
section SMul
```

```suggestion
end SMul
```
Shouldn't this be Basic Algebra I?
Thanks for spotting! I've opened #19027

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Incidence algebras
